title: ProLogium Announces €5.2b Gigafactory in Dunkirk France and Greets French President Emmanuel Macron
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Dunkirk, France, at the port of Dunkirk, within the Northern France’s “Battery Valley”.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the gigafactory is 48 GWh.

Investment amounts:
- ProLogium will invest a total of €5.2 billion into the project. The company also plans to establish an R&D center in France as part of its localization efforts.

Project progress:
- The construction is set to begin in the second half of 2024, with production scheduled to start by the end of 2026. The project has received support from the French government and is expected to create 3,000 direct jobs and 12,000 indirect jobs for the local Dunkirk community by 2030.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the gigafactory being strategically located in Europe.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the entire value chain stages, including cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

Note: The project is expected to contribute to the development of the battery valley in Northern France and accelerate the transition to clean transportation with solid-state battery industrialization.

title: Taiwanese battery maker Prologium to invest €5 billion in French factory
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Dunkirk, northern France.

Capacity:
- The group aims to start production at the end of 2026 and ramp up over several years until it has some 3,000 employees in the factory.
- It plans to invest 5.2 billion euros ($5.7 billion) in Dunkirk by 2030 and produce batteries for hundreds of thousands of cars once at full capacity.

Investment amounts:
- The project will receive an investment of 5.2 billion euros ($5.7 billion) by 2030.
- ProLogium is planning an IPO in the future to help finance its investments and is looking for European incentives for the green industry.

Project progress:
- The group hopes to start production at the end of 2026 and ramp up over several years until it has some 3,000 employees in the factory.
- ProLogium is planning an IPO in the future to help finance its investments and is looking for European incentives for the green industry.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as it involves the construction of a new factory in northern France.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly for battery production.

title: ProLogium Introduces 2nd-Gen Solid-State Battery, Porsche Consolidates Battery Production
notes:
Location:
- ProLogium is planning to build its first overseas solid-state battery factory in Dunkirk, France.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the Dunkirk factory is 48 GWh per year once all phases of the project are completed.

Investment amounts:
- The Dunkirk factory will require an investment of €5.2 billion.

Project progress:
- In May, ProLogium announced the plan to build the solid-state battery factory in Dunkirk, France. The factory is expected to start operations this year and will serve as a manufacturing base to supply the European EV market.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new solid-state battery factory in Dunkirk, France.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cell fabrication and module assembly for the production of solid-state batteries.

title: ProLogium gets Gigafactory Grant from European Commission for Solid-State Battery Manufacturing in Dunkirk, France > EV Tech Insider
notes:
Location:
- The battery manufacturing plant is located in Dunkirk, France.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the gigafactory is 48 GWh.

Investment amounts:
- The total investment amounts to €5.2 billion, with a €1.5 billion grant approved by the European Commission under the European framework for State aid for research, development, and innovation (RDIF).

Project progress:
- Construction of the Gigafactory is set to begin in the second half of 2024, with production estimated to start by the end of 2026. ProLogium is actively scouting locations and talent for its R&D center. The next step for ProLogium is the launch of the public consultation process under the aegis of the CNDP, which will begin in September 2023.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with construction set to begin in the second half of 2024.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

title: ProLogium receives €1.5 billion public grant for Its Gigafactory Project in Dunkirk
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Dunkirk, France.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the project is 48 GWh.

Investment amounts:
- The total investment amounts to €5.2 billion, with ProLogium receiving a €1.5 billion grant from the French government according to different milestones until 2029.

Project progress:
- The project has received a substantial grant from the French government, approved by the European Commission, under the European framework for State aid for research, development, and innovation (RDIF). The next steps include the launch of the public consultation process in September 2023, with construction set to begin in the second half of 2024 and production estimated to start by the end of 2026.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the construction of a gigafactory.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.
